definition: crowded to bursting point/filled to overflowing/jam-packed
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)

sentences.english: The old house was soon crowded with relatives and Grandpa's friends.
sentences.chinese: 老屋里很快挤满了亲戚和爷爷的朋友。

sentences.english: Vendors' stalls crowd the beachside road in Pattaya.
sentences.chinese: 在芭堤雅，售货摊挤满了海滨区的道路。

sentences.english: The plane was full of holiday-makers.
sentences.chinese: 飞机场挤满了去度假的人。

sentences.english: Nanjing Road and Huaihai Road are always crowded with people.
sentences.chinese: 南京路和淮海路都挤满了人。

sentences.english: The bus was so packed and I got totally squished this morning.
sentences.chinese: 公交车挤满了人，我今天早上几乎被压扁了。

sentences.english: His office was swarmed with many reporters.
sentences.chinese: 他的办公室里挤满了记者。

sentences.english: Marylebone Station was packed with homeward- bound commuters.
sentences.chinese: 马里列本火车站挤满了要回家去的旅客。

sentences.english: I head to the heart of the islet and find the centre filled with market stalls.
sentences.chinese: 我走向小岛中间，发现那里挤满了摊档。

sentences.english: The temple was full of devotees wanting to pray to the god.
sentences.chinese: 当时这庙里挤满了要向神祈祷的信徒。

sentences.english: And there was the ferryboat full of people floating along down.
sentences.chinese: 渡船上挤满了人，正往下游漂来。

sentences.english: Attendees registering for the meeting crowded the lobby of the Moscone Center.
sentences.chinese: 茅斯考恩中心的大厅挤满了正准备登记的与会者。

sentences.english: It's the same every year, packed with Muggles , of course, come on.
sentences.chinese: 每年都一样，挤满了麻瓜，这是当然的，过来吧。

sentences.english: It was packed tight with people.
sentences.chinese: 它里面密匝匝地挤满了人。

sentences.english: They crowd round the tap and splash water over their faces .
sentences.chinese: 自来水龙头边挤满了人，用手捧些水来浇在脸上。

sentences.english: A large crowd of customers swarmed before the counter .
sentences.chinese: 柜台前挤满了一大群顾客。

sentences.english: Court packed with 80 reporters and 25 federal special police.
sentences.chinese: 庭上挤满80名记者及25名联邦特警。

definition: lit. not one drop can trickle through (idiom); fig. impenetrable (crowd, traffic)
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
lit. a banquet with no empty seats/full house/capacity crowd/standing room only
